intro: Radlkoferella grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered radlkoferella, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are compound, with a fern-like appearance, and its stems are often branched. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
